title: Bota Box 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Beautiful raspberry aromas and very fresh fruit flavors make this medium-bodied Zin an attractive and very affordable wine for big parties. It's not tannic but soft and easy on the palate.

title: Stelios Kechris 2014 Kechribari Roditis (Retsina)
description: Earthy herbal aromas tinged with honey and citrus start this intense but balanced retsina. On the palate, the wine offers herbal and tropical fruit flavors with a delicate, spicy spin. Pair with grilled fish, robust cheeses.

title: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This is a forward, slightly sweet-tasting wine, with flavors of cherry candy. The up-front fruitiness leads into some drying, astringent tannins, with notes of tea and tobacco.

title: Judge Palmer 2013 Ellis Alden Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a skin-contact wine, fermented on skins for a week, that displays the technique in its dark golden color. From there, it's ripe in a sweetness of baked pear, honey and dried apricot, while lean on the palate despite the fleshy nature of the fruit.

title: MandraRossa 2015 Grecanico (Sicilia)
description: Opening with aromas of citrus blossom and acacia flower, the straightforward palate offers yellow apple, nectarine and chopped herb. Fresh acidity produces a tangy finish.

title: MandraRossa 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of citrus, dried herb and yellow flower lead. On the straightforward palate, fresh acidity underscores yellow apple and lemon zest while a bitter almond note closes.

title: Domaine Michel Fonne 2013 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Pure red fruit seems to have a bruised apple edge. The palate is simple and easy-drinking and despite its pretty ruby color comes across as a rosé, with barely a touch of tannin. Chill this for a surprise at a party.

title: Domaine Michel Fonne 2014 Grains de Génie White (Alsace)
description: A distinctly aromatic nose tells of honeysuckle while the dry, light palate is sherbety and less defined. Drink this easygoing wine soon, while aromas are fresh.

title: Edmeades 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This is a good-time wine that's superrich and fruity. It's easy to drink and enjoy, uncomplicated and jammy in flavor and soft in texture.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2013 Reserve Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: The wine's very reserved nose requires patience to release the asphalt and blackberry jam aromas. Berry flavors show on the palate as does some asphalt and pepper. Everything feels balanced but it could use some more power and punch.

title: Heringer 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Clarksburg)
description: This is a juicy, medium-bodied wine that gushes with cherry and ripe plum flavors, and has an easy texture without much tannin. It's nice and smooth and easy to appreciate.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2014 Vieilles Vignes Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: A lovely, citrus-scented lightness governs nose and palate. The lemony streak counters the richer palate.

title: Easton 2013 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Earthy, leathery aromas and dense tobacco and cedar flavors make this wine a bit of a taste adventure. The mouthfeel is posh and finely tannic, and black cherry and dark chocolate notes kick in and last through the finish.

title: Reustle 2014 Maranatha Bloc Merlot (Umpqua Valley)
description: Don't look for much flesh here—it's a light, quaffable style with suggestions of hard cherry candy. Barrel aging adds highlights of ground coffee, with firm acidity carrying the finish.

title: Reustle 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Essentially a clonal selection, this reserve is marked by flavors of black tea, cut tobacco and a broad streak of vanilla. The cherry flavors remain in the background.

title: Esperanza 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Aromas of orange zest, apple cider and yeast come in front of a plump, slightly wayward palate with citric acidity. Generic citrus flavors finish lemony but with acidic scour.

title: Mont Gravet 2015 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: An attractive pale-salmon color, this 100% Cinsault rosé opens with soft scents of strawberry, pear, melon rind and earthy spice. The palate is lush, with fleshy fruit flavors that are balanced by ample acidity and a soft tannic astringency on the close.

title: Murphy-Goode 2014 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This clean and relatively crisp wine has mild fruit-salad flavors and lively acidity. It's medium-bodied, not too assertive and should please a crowd.

title: Reustle 2014 Trinity Cuvée Spéciale Red (Umpqua Valley)
description: This unusual blend marries Grenache, Pinot Noir and Malbec—in other words, Rhône, Burgundy and Bordeaux. None of the three is dominant, and the result is a pretty wine, with light raspberry fruit, and highlights of toast and coffee.

title: Marrenon 2015 Roséfine Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: This is a coppery-tinged, pale-flamingo pink blend of Grenache, Syrah and Merlot that's dry and taut. Crisp flavors of underripe stone fruit and melon provide ample summer refreshment. Drink now.

title: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Malbec (Lodi)
description: The generous fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, smooth-textured wine are like those in a cherry-rhubarb pie but without the sugar. Light herbal olive aromas start it out.

title: Morse 2010 Three Popes Estate Red (Amador County)
description: Very ripe, very full bodied and very tannic, this wine is bold and tasty. It has raisin and dried plum aromas, a flavor that is warm with alcohol, and a mouthfilling texture.

title: Soléna 2012 Wooldridge Creek Vineyard Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Despite the excellent vintage, this seems more tannic than ripe. The fruit is simple and leafy, with tea flavors and a chalky finish.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2013 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Simple, but up-front strawberry fruit reigns on nose and palate of this very light-bodied red. The palate is soft, easy, dry and fresh and would take very well to chilling on a warm day.

title: Kudos 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Round and fruity, this opens with mildly sweet flavors of melon and pineapple. The quick finish turns flat and slightly sour.

title: Lawer 2013 Betsy's Vineyard Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Dark, black and leathery, this wine has an Old-World spirit and rusticity, a dearth of fruit under smooth, thick and dense tannins as well as oak.

title: Van Ruiten 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Lively aromas like crisp apple and white peach join more creamy, pastry-like flavors of butter, vanilla and toasted almond in this medium-bodied wine. It is soft in texture and so fruity it seems sweet on the finish.

title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Terres Douces Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is tangy and textured with light tannins, a bite of citrus acidity and plenty of fruit. It's bright and has a juicy, lively aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Viña Otano 2014 Viura (Rioja)
description: Largely neutral on the nose, then tangy and still fresh on the palate, this drink-now Viura is clean but unexciting. Flavors of generic citrus finish firm, with a pithy aftertaste.

title: Tenute Girolamo 2014 La Voliera Aglianico (Puglia)
description: Made with 100% Aglianico, this offers aromas of underbrush, red berry and tilled soil. The simple, accessible palate shows dried plum and mature blackberry alongside hearty tannins. Enjoy soon.
